Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that COVID-19 is a real disease.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by calling COVID-19 a hoax.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed by scientific evidence or research.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the virologist Dr. Rob Oswald supports the idea that COVID-19 is a hoax, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim falsely attributes the post to Dr. Rob Oswald, when in fact it was written by an anonymous individual.
